item.title: CX Tutorial: Using Affordances to Build a Small Text-based Adventure
item.description: Introduction Challenge-response Architecture Affordance System Objects Conclusion Introduction This tutorial presents a text-based “game” (the user does not interact with the program, and can not influence the character’s decisions) that uses a challenge-response architecture to determine what are the possible actions the game’s character can do. The full source-code can be found in CX’s repository, in the file examples/text-based-adventure.cx. The game describes the adventure of a traveler that is escaping from a monster (Halloween is coming next month, after all).

item.title: CX Overview
item.description: CX Introduction Project’s Repository Syntax Affordances Arity Restrictions Type Restrictions Existential Restrictions Identifier Restrictions Boundaries Restrictions User-defined Restrictions Strict Typing System Compiled and Interpreted Read-Eval-Print Loop Meta-programming Commands Stepping Interactive Debugging Integrated Evolutionary Algorithm Serialization CX Introduction CX is both a specification and a programming language designed to embrace a new programming paradigm based on the concept of affordances. Affordances allow a program to know what actions can and cannnot be done by it.
